intro: Polygala furcata, commonly known as the forked milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family, which includes various species with distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat.
